hackathon-description-text: We're looking for mission and impact-driven people to build for good. At
hackathon-eligibility:
Groups may not exceed more than four team members.

Anything you submit should be open sourced, you should be okay with giving your code, designs, materials to the nonprofit. We're here to help them change the world and that starts with sharing.

We're here to help people think about building for impact and to help our nonprofit partners find the best solutions possible. You can begin submitting solutions on June 15, 2015 and so you can begin working on ideas before this date. 

Any student who is currently attending a U.S. institution university or college may participate in the challenge. However, winners who want to interview for the KPCB Fellows program must also meet all eligibility requirements for the program. Eligibility requirements for the program can be found here: 
 

For any questions about the KPCB Fellows Challenge, email Justin at
hackathon-rules:
Groups may not exceed more than four team members.

Anything you submit should be open sourced, you should be okay with giving your code, designs, materials to the nonprofit. We're here to help them change the world and that starts with sharing.

We're here to help people think about building for impact and to help our nonprofit partners find the best solutions possible. You can begin submitting solutions on June 15, 2015 and so you can begin working on ideas before this date. 

Any student who is currently attending a U.S. institution university or college may participate in the challenge. However, winners who want to interview for the KPCB Fellows program must also meet all eligibility requirements for the program. Eligibility requirements for the program can be found here: 

For any questions about the KPCB Fellows Challenge, email Justin at jsayarath@kpcb.com.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The first place winning group will receive a $1000 cash prize and each member will receive an interview for either the design, engineering, or product fellows program for summer 2016.
Each member of the second place winning group will receive an interview for either the design, engineering, or product fellows program for summer 2016.
Each member of the third place winning group will receive an interview for either the design, engineering, or product fellows program for summer 2016.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Clearly addresses one of the KPCB Fellows challenges
Submitted to our challengepost tagged with KPCB Build for Good and submitted to the appropriate challenge at kpcbfellows.com/challenges
Offers a scalable solution to the challenge
Realistic and implementable by the nonprofit
Gives the nonprofit a good starting off point to run with the solution

hackathon-description-header: We're looking for mission and impact-driven people to build for good. Help us solve tough non-profit challenges with innovative tech.
